info.title: EBANQ Rest API
info.description:
## Introduction:
The EBANQ REST API permits applications to connect securely to the EBANQ software to carry out a multitude of operations. Depending on the operations in question, authentication and token-based access control is enforced. 

To interact with your EBANQ system via the EBANQ API you need to send requests to the backend (API) URL.  This base URL can be determined by prepending “api-“ to your EBANQ system’s URL. If your EBANQ system is hosted at https://login.mydomain.com then the base API URL will be https://api-login.mydomain.com . 

The documentation that follows is intended for developers, providing an introduction to using the API and additionally describing all currently available endpoints. We recommend you read the documentation to familarise yourself with conventions, parameters and response structure. A dedicated sandbox for testing purposes can be made available to clients upon request. 

Please contact help@ebanq.com should you have additional questions or require support. 


## Tokens:
  | Name | Token type | Description | Default lifetime |
  | ------- | -------- | --------- | ----------- |
  | Access token  | [JWT](https://jwt.io/)., Bearer token | Used to make requests to the API | 30m |
  | Refresh token | [JWT](https://jwt.io/) token         | Used to update access and refresh tokens pair | 30d |

## Access token usage
  API requests (where authorisation is required) must include the bearer access token in the header. 

  Once the access token expires it should be refreshed.

## How to determine if the token has expired

1. The API returns a 401 error.
2. Check the `exp` field in the token payloads.


## Refresh token usage

**Refresh** token is only used to update **access** and **refresh** tokens.

After completing the request, old tokens (access and refresh) are invalidated and new tokens must be saved and used in subsequent requests.


## Token structure:
  | Key name | Description |
  | -------- | -------- |
  | sub  | Subject: access or refresh |
  | exp  | Expiration date and time in UNIX format |
  | uid | Token owner ID |
  | firstName | First name of the token owner |
  | lastName | Last name of the token owner |
  | username | Username of the token owner |
  | roleName | Role name of the token owner |

## Timestamps:
RFC3339 is used for the time in requests and responses.

post.summary: Create a new account as admin.
post.description: Not allowed if admin has no "create_accounts" permission. Also admin need "create_accounts_with_initial_balance" permission to create account with not zero balance.

get.summary: Show list of accounts belonging to the user.
get.description: Responds with accounts collection associated with current user. Has includes of related models, filters, sortings, pagination.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Used to load nested resources associated with account.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorts records. Can be sorted in DESC direction by adding "-" prefix.

parameters.name: filter[numberContains]
parameters.description: Applies filter by number. Checks if number contains passed value. Can be used for search.

parameters.name: filter[typeId]
parameters.description: Applies filter by typeId.

parameters.name: filter[isActive]
parameters.description: Applies filter by isActive.

parameters.description: Applies filter by allowWithdrawals.

parameters.name: filter[userId]
parameters.description: Applies filter by userId.

parameters.name: filter[accountType.currencyCode]
parameters.description: Applies filter by currencyCode in account type.

parameters.name: filter[isIwtInstructionsAvailable]
parameters.description: Return accounts which have IWT bank account.

put.summary: Update an existing account by ID as admin.
put.description: Not allowed if admin has no "modify_accounts" permission.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Account ID

get.description: Available for admins and users. Not allowed if user is not an account owner. Available for admins with one of permissions: 'view_accounts', 'view_user_reports', 'initiate_execute_user_transfers'

parameters.description: Account id

get.summary: Show a request details.
get.description:
Available for users who has account used in transaction of this request.
\
Available for admins who has any of permissions: "execute_cancel_pending_transfer_requests" or "initiate_execute_user_transfers".

parameters.name: requestId

patch.description: Available for admins who has "execute_cancel_pending_transfer_requests" permission.

parameters.description: Request id

post.description: Available for admins who has "execute_cancel_pending_transfer_requests" permissions. The reason parameter is a cancellation reason.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request id

post.description:
Available for admins who has "import_transfer_request_updates" permission.

\
This updates rate and status by request id for all passed requests. File should contain header with following columns: "Request ID", "Status", "Exchange rate".

Available for admins who has "manual_debit_credit_accounts" permission.

\
This created credit or debit requests from csv file.

\
File should contain following columns: "Account number", "Debit or Credit", "Amount", "Description", "Revenue", "Apply IWT Fee".
\
1 column - an existing account number.
\
2 column - an request type. Possible values: "debit" or "credit".
\
3 column - amount that should be added or subtracted.
\
4 column - description.
\
5 column - use revenue amount in request (debit/credit depends on second colum). Values: "yes" or "no"
\
6 column - need to apply IWT Fee. Values: "yes" or "no"

get.summary: Refresh token

attached.description: Indicates whether the fee should be attached to user group or not.

delete.description: set to true if parameter should be removed

base.description: Must be a valid decimal number and greater than zero.

min.description: Must be a valid decimal number and greater than zero.

percent.description: Must be a valid decimal number and greater than zero.

userId.description: Must be an id of exisiting user.

number.description: should match one of patterns: "^[0-9]{16}$", "^[a-zA-Z0-9]{1,19}$". A pattern depends on card type format.

currencyCode.description: must be an code of active currency.

quantity.description: How many TANs should be created?

cancelOld.description: Reset previously generated TANs if set to true.

snapshots.description: Use optional include parameter "balanceSnapshots" in order to include this section.

balanceType.description: Use optional include parameter "balanceSnapshots.balanceType" in order to include this section.

source.description: Name of field if target is 'field'
Name of field if target is 'field'

challenge_name.description: This information indicates that the user should do something. For example if the value is equal 'new_password_required' it means the user should change own password.

uid.description: 0 for questions available system-wide, or the owning uid for custom per-user questions.

challengeName.description: this field is used to determinate if an additional action is required e.g. `new_password_required` when the user must be prompted to change his password.

oneTime.description: The thread will be deleted after reading if it is "true"

meta.description: Contains additional information about the thread in JSON format. For example user group name if message is sent to the user group.

isAllowed.description: Defines if user is allowed to perform some action

path.description: The path is constructed as: section/group/field.
The path is constructed as: section/group/field.

class_id.description: Existing admin class id. Defines admin permissions.
Existing admin class id. Defines admin permissions.

source.description: Name of field if target is 'field'

email.description: email or username of a user
email or username of a user

TAN.name: X-TAN
TAN.description: One time transaction password (TAN). Must be provided if corresponding setting is enabled.

CreatedAtFrom.name: filter[createdAtFrom]
CreatedAtFrom.description: Applies filter by createdAt. Returns records where date >= passed.

CreatedAtTo.name: filter[createdAtTo]
CreatedAtTo.description: Applies filter by createdAt. Returns records where date < passed.

PageSize.name: page[size]
PageSize.description: Specifies count of objects returned in response. Default value is 20.

PageNumber.name: page[number]
PageNumber.description: Specifies page number to be shown in response. size + number makes offset for records. Default value is 1.

StatusEq.name: filter[status:eq]
StatusEq.description: For filtering by status using equal operator

StatusNeq.name: filter[status:neq]
StatusNeq.description: For filtering by status using not equal operator

StatusIn.name: filter[status:in]
StatusIn.description: For filtering by status using in operator

StatusNin.name: filter[status:nin]
StatusNin.description: For filtering by status using not in operator

currencyPathID.name: id
currencyPathID.description: Id of a currency to show. Integer value or "main". Returns main currency if "main" id is passed.

loggedAtFromFilter.name: filter[loggedAtFrom]
loggedAtFromFilter.description: For filtering by logged at from date. Rule is records where date >= passed

loggedAtToFilter.name: filter[loggedAtTo]
loggedAtToFilter.description: For filtering by logged at to date. Rule is records where date < passed

Include.name: include
Include.description: Used to include specific related models, fields to the response. Usage: include=recentMessageSender,sender,messages and etc

Query.name: filter[query]
Query.description: Search by message subject and message body.

Dir.name: filter[dir]
Dir.description: Applies filter by direction (incoming or outgoing).

CreatedAtGte.name: filter[createdAt:gte]
CreatedAtGte.description: Applies filter by createdAt. Returns records where message creation date is greather than or equal to date in query.

LastMessageCreatedAtLte.name: filter[lastMessageCreatedAt:lte]
LastMessageCreatedAtLte.description: Applies filter by lastMessageCreatedAt. Returns records where last message creation date is less than or equal to date in query.

LastMessageCreatedAtGte.name: filter[lastMessageCreatedAtGte:gte]
LastMessageCreatedAtGte.description: Applies filter by lastMessageCreatedAtGte. Returns records where last message creation date is greather than or equal to date in query.

CreatedAtLte.name: filter[createdAt:lte]
CreatedAtLte.description: Applies filter by createdAt. Returns records where message creation date is less than or equal to date in query.

SortCreatedAt.name: sort[createdAt]
SortCreatedAt.description: Sort by message creation date. Usage: sort[-createdAt] to sort the result-set in descending order, sort[createdAt] to sort the result-set in ascending order

SortUpdatedAt.name: sort[updatedAt]
SortUpdatedAt.description: Sort by message creation date. Usage: sort[-updatedAt] to sort the result-set in descending order, sort[updatedAt] to sort the result-set in ascending order

SortLastMessageCreatedAt.name: sort[lastMessageCreatedAt]
SortLastMessageCreatedAt.description: Sort by message creation date. Usage: sort[-lastMessageCreatedAt] to sort the result-set in descending order, sort[lastMessageCreatedAt] to sort the result-set in ascending order

SortSubject.name: sort[subject]
SortSubject.description: Sort by message creation date. Usage: sort[-subject] to sort the result-set in descending order, sort[subject] to sort the result-set in ascending order

filtersDateFrom.name: filters[dateFrom]
filtersDateFrom.description: For filtering by created at from date. Rule is records where date >= passed. Format: 2018-11-20T00:00:00 02:00

filtersDateTo.name: filters[dateTo]
filtersDateTo.description: For filtering by created at to date. Rule is records where date <= passed. Format: 2018-12-03T23:59:59 02:00

pageSize.name: page[size]
pageSize.description: Specifies count of objects returned in response.

pageNumber.name: page[number]
pageNumber.description: Specifies page number to be shown in response. size + number makes offset for records.

TmpAuth.name: X-Tmp-Auth
TmpAuth.description: JWT which provides an access to the "limited" endpoints. This token is in response after signup process.
